Bully Bot

Inspiration

Las tendencias que se han generado con base a polémicas de tipo discriminatorio, bullying y racial, además de la falta de políticas de prevención de ellas. Grupos tales como negros, homosexuales, refugiados políticos, migrantes,etc que deben ser respetados.

What it does

Es un Bot que se encarga de generar conciencia social, por medio de mensajes de texto con contenido real de agresiones que sufren los grupos vulnerables dependiendo a cuál esta dirigido,

How we built it

Por medio Python, se implemento el API de Telegram. Igualmente generamos un sitio web, con herramientas front-end en donde se genera el desenlace del uso de la aplicación.

Challenges we ran into

Hack Harrasment Challenge

Accomplishments that we're proud of

Estamos orgullosos de poder encontrar un tema que a todo el equipo le apasiono, la educación moral y de valores esta siendo olvidada, y el equipo logro consolidar una idea viable en un equipo multidisciplinario y con bases sustentadas en las Ciencias Sociales y Biológicas.

What we learned

Aprendimos a resolver conflictos de índole social, ya que existe una complejidad en el aterrizaje de un tema general que a toda la población le afecta.

What's next for Bully Bot

Elevar la idea a realidad virtual, trasladando el bot a una apropiación de la situación, siendo los usuarios los que recreen la personificación de la persona vulnerable.

Chefcito

Inspiración

Quisimos desarrollar chefcito para evitar el desperdicio de comida, para las ocasiones en las que contamos con ingredientes pero no tenemos idea que cocinar.

Que es lo que hace?

Toma una lista de ingredientes y genera una lista de recetas posibles con los ingredientes de la lista. También puede reconocer imágenes o fotos de productos para evitar el proceso de escribir los ingredientes,

Como lo construímos

Esta construido en node.js y esta orientado a conexiones por medio de API´s, empleamos google vision api para el reconocimiento de objetos, amazon web services con virtual private networks para la infraestructura, wit.ai para pattern matching de palabras y facebook messenger

Logros

  • Obtener imágenes de conversaciones de facebook
  • Crear un bot

Que aprendimos

  • Conexión con servicios de vision api
  • Uso de VPN y grupos de autoescalado de amazon web services

10_Lazarillo

• An image of our prototype

Inspiration

Helping blind people for them to feel safer, more self-sufficient and productive as members of society. Also one of the main reasons why we are building it is because we want to avoid accidents that involve people suffering from permanent or temporary blindness.

What it does

The prototype has two configurations, one for the temporarily blind people or people with low visual abilities and one for the permanently blind people. The first one operates with sounds coming out from a buzzer, this sounds are regulated by a proximity sensor which vary according to how near is a wall, an object or a person. The Second One will give commands very much alike the first ones but using vibrations instead of sounds, this is because people that cannot see since their birth have a hugely developed hearing sense, so the sounds would stun them or maybe even disorient them.

How we built it

Our prototype is a cane that calculates distance between the person and an object nearby in order to avoid a collision between these two, it is built with arduino uno and an ultrasonic sensor, we also used a buzzer module, bluetooth modules and Android technology to make the applications.

Challenges we ran into

Unfortunately, the members of our team are not immensely good in programming as the rest of the competition probably is, so that was a huge disadvantage for us. Also we lost our bluetooth modules so it was not possible for us to complete the configuration that applies for permanently blind people.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

We managed to complete the part that applies for temporarily blind people and we also did an application in MIT's App Inventor that delivers messages to a phone that simulates what in the future will be a vibrating bracelet.

What we learned

We learn a lot about programming a pebble watch and android apps. Also we learned how to pitch ideas in order to sell them to business men that may be interested in investing on our product for a better development of this project.

What's next for 10_Lazarillo

Getting a properly developed version with two modes for each configuration that resembles a street mode and a subway mode so blind people can transport on their own across the city by selecting their destination. Also we would love to improve our already improvised hardware.

Built With

  • arduino
  • android
  • sensors
  • motors
  • buzzers

Weeping Zombies

We live life as an adventure full of breathtaking experiences. Virtual reality has pushed the limits of human consciousness and allowed us to live life on the borders of euphoria and absolute freedom. This core beliefs serve as our driving mechanism to create technologies that make us happy to be ALIVE right now.

As a hardworking team of 3 engineering students in freshman year; we planned, designed and executed a prototype of a suspense video game. We used the Oculus Rift VR gear as an interactive approach to modern gaming coupled with the acclaimed 3D game engine Unity.

We´re specially proud of our collaboration and contribution of specific skills which was only possible thanks to the great environment and organization provided by all the staff.

The whole project was a big challenge for us but it was enjoyable as well. Our first obstacle was setting up the VR interaction as this was our first time experimenting with these awesome gadgets offered by MxHacks. The following difficulty was developing games in 3D without previous experience either in a programming language and development environment we had never used before. At the end we were able to solve all of these issues with significant effort, and it paid off beautifully.

During these 24h of creative insight and competitive initiative we learned new skills in interactive technologies but most importantly we improved our ability to work as a team and working with dedication and passion to achieve our goals.

We successfully built a pretty awesome video game and profoundly seek to continue our development of Weeping Zombies. The next step is creating beautiful animations and immersive immersive environments with the hopes of further pleasing our users.

  • c#
  • unity

2 - Bastón Inteligente

• Output de arduino

  • Notificaion

  • Notificacion

  • Activity

  • Animación de prueba del acelerómetro y giroscopio

  • Arduino 101

Inspiration

Comenzamos con varias ideas, una de ellas era hacer uso de beacons para detectar la proximidad de personas de la tercera edad y automatizar procesos del hogar, sin embargo no contábamos con beacons, así que investigamos sobre unos Arduinos y el arduino 101 contaba con un acelerómetro. Comenzamos a hablar sobre los accidentes que suelen ocurrir y no hay nadie cerca para auxiliarte, identificando algunas funciones de impacto del arduino.

What it does

Bastón inteligente El objetivo del prototipo es identificar cuando una persona de la tercera edad tiene algún percance, haciendo uso del internet de las cosas para detectar golpes o movimientos bruscos a través de un acelerómetro en algún objeto de uso diario, como un bastón, para notificar a alguna persona sobre un accidente o posible agresión, agilizando la respuesta de auxilio.

How we built it

Se realizó una aplicación que hacia uso de los servicios de firebase para notificaciones PUSH, con la finalidad de recibir la señal emitida por el arduino 101 y desplegar una notificación de alerta. Esta aplicación esta pensada para que los familiares o amigos cercanos puedan recibir la señal de auxilio.

La parte del hardware fue realizada usando un arduino 101 como placa de adquisición de datos, mediante la lectura de los registros del sensor giroscópico y el acelerómetro que tiene integrado. La idea es procesar los datos y detectar golpes, lo cual podría indicar que la persona sufrió un accidente, y así emitir una señal de alarma que será interpretada por algún servicio.

Challenges we ran into

Accomplishments that we're proud of

De lo que se pudo lograr en la noche

What we learned

A trabajar con arreglos de datos del puerto sereal del arduino, investigar en muchas fuentes de información para poder graficar las señales emitidas por el arduino.

What's next for Bastón Inteligente

Concluir algunos aspectos como la inclusión del modulo wifi Particle PHOTON a arduino, poder incluir la función de bluetooth.para conectar con otro dispositivo y obtener ubicación de las personas.

  • arduino

When we came in the morning, one of the problems that we noticed was the lack of order at the moment of searching for all the participants in the database, later we though we could fix this problem not just in the major league of hacking, we can make things easier for everyone willing to make an event.

What it does

In simple words it makes things easier for you when you need to make an event and you have a lot of guests in your list, you will never need to worry about sending emails, checking everyone pass, etcetera, we'll do that for you!

It's a simple API made on the popular nodejs framework: sailsjs, then a device based on arduino connected to the API is in charge of validate the guests

WhiteTread Solutions

Inspiration

Through the industrial segment of the business that now a day’s impact directly in the environment we are living in.

WhiteTread Solutions looks forward to keep a green-production.

What it does

Through the Pro-Green Certification, we verify that the consumption of resources is the minimum necessary to operate.

The benefits for companies with a Pro-Green Certification are:

  1. Tax reductions
  2. Special prices for replacing old machinery
  3. Special discounts on energy bill
  4. Constant Monitoring of your resource expenses
  5. Positive impact in the environment around them

How we built it

Also, we can help your company to reduce the cost of production by constantly analyze and detect anomalies from data gathered on demand from your machinery.

All this is possible using industrial on demand software PREDIX, provided by our main partner General Electric.

Challenges we ran into

-Getting known to the platform PREDIX -Making client application for getting data

-Demo of the system for making audits for the certification -Modeling Data

What's next for WhiteTread Solutions

-Implementing the solution in a real world environment -Find more benefits for the Pro-Green Certification

8 - floralint

• florallint

Inspiration

Testing for accessibility is a fundamental part of the development process that is often neglected in small and big problems alike, making a huge amount of the web inaccessible for people with disabilities. Current tools for testing accessibility are clunky and web based, by making a tool for the terminal, most teams are going to be able to include floralinter into their development pipeline.

What it does

Floralinter tests the urls of a website for compliance with the WCAG 2.0 standard, it does this by running a command from the terminal.

How we built it

We decided to built it using python 3.5, making use of the following libraries: urllib and BeautifulSoup. The reason we decided to implementing it using python is so everybody can install it on their systems via pip, and use it in their CI process with Travis, and tools alike.

Challenges we ran into

Testing for accessibility is quite complicated, because several of the failure criteria defined in the WCAG 2.0 standard depend on heuristics in order to be properly tested. Due to this, we are currently working on implementing the stricter failure rules first, leaving the rest for when we have time to discuss them at depth.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

As always, it is very important for us to be open and be source. So we have opened this project for everyone to collaborate and discuss, in the case of this project it is even more important due to the great impact that this project could have on every single development project.

What we learned

We learned that accessibility is a crucial issue in the modern world, that does not get enough attention. We also learned why it doesn't have the support it should, and the answer is that it is hard. That is why we have also implemented the infrastructure necessary to increase the scope and reach of the project.

What's next for floralint

We are going to continue development, until we have a comprehensive tool to test a website for accessibility. As a matter of fact we would love to invite everybody that reads this to work with us over at github.

Built With

  • python

Try it out

  • github.com
I worked on implementing the fail rules from the WCAG 2.0 standard, and creating a method for testing them through the terminal.

I worked on crawling the web page to obtain and crawl the style sheets from a the local server and parse its rules and errors, also worked on crawling the page to obtain all the js related nodes, such as the events and their related functions, also implemented a test site in order to prove the concept
